14.1.2 Protein restriction 
Any imbalance of gestational macronutrient intake may alter metabolic programming [11,16]. Restriction 
of protein, the most widely studied form of gestational undernutrition, is thought to be key to the so-called 
developmental origin of health and disease [3,17,18]. Amino acids are vital as substrates for cellular 
proteins, hormones and other signalling molecules. Conversely, amino acids and their derivatives can, in high 
concentrations, act as pat
